metadata.name: UAE Corporate Tax Law Q&A Dataset
metadata.description: Synthetic Q&A pairs for RAG evaluation based on UAE Corporate Tax Law

questions.question: What is the standard corporate tax rate in the UAE?
questions.expected_answer: 9% on taxable income exceeding AED 375,000

questions.question: Who is exempt from corporate tax in the UAE?
questions.expected_answer: Government entities, government controlled entities, extractive businesses, non-extractive natural resource businesses, qualifying public benefit entities, qualifying investment funds, public pension funds, social security funds, and private pension funds

questions.question: When does the UAE Corporate Tax Law come into effect?
questions.expected_answer: Tax Periods commencing on or after 1 June 2023

questions.question: How is taxable income calculated under the UAE Corporate Tax Law?
questions.expected_answer: Taxable income is calculated based on accounting income prepared in accordance with accounting standards, subject to adjustments as specified in the law

questions.question: What is the arm's length principle for transfer pricing?
questions.expected_answer: Transactions between Related Parties must be conducted as if they were between independent parties dealing at arm's length

questions.question: What are the penalties for violations under the Corporate Tax Law?
questions.expected_answer: Administrative penalties as specified in the Tax Procedures Law, and the Authority may assess corporate tax where a person fails to comply

questions.question: What are the conditions for a Free Zone Person to benefit from 0% tax rate?
questions.expected_answer: Must be a Qualifying Free Zone Person, maintain adequate substance, derive Qualifying Income, and comply with transfer pricing rules

questions.question: What are the requirements for forming a Tax Group?
questions.expected_answer: Parent company must own at least 95% of share capital and voting rights, same financial year, prepared using same accounting standards, not exempt persons or Free Zone Persons

questions.question: How are tax losses carried forward?
questions.expected_answer: Tax Losses can be carried forward and set off against Taxable Income of subsequent Tax Periods, subject to limitations based on ownership changes

questions.question: What types of income are exempt from corporate tax?
questions.expected_answer: Dividends and other profit distributions from UAE companies, capital gains from sale of shares in qualifying conditions, income from qualifying restructuring transactions

questions.question: Who must register for corporate tax in the UAE?
questions.expected_answer: Every Taxable Person must register for Corporate Tax purposes with the Authority

questions.question: When must a tax return be filed?
questions.expected_answer: Within 9 months from the end of the relevant Tax Period

questions.question: What constitutes a Permanent Establishment?
questions.expected_answer: A fixed place of business through which the business is wholly or partly carried on, or a person who habitually exercises authority to conclude contracts

questions.question: How are Related Parties defined?
questions.expected_answer: Persons are related if one controls the other, or they are under common control, or through ownership of 50% or more

questions.question: What is the small business relief threshold?
questions.expected_answer: Revenue does not exceed AED 3,000,000 in the relevant Tax Period and all previous Tax Periods

questions.question: Is there a withholding tax on payments to non-residents?
questions.expected_answer: Withholding Tax at 0% applies to payments of UAE sourced income to non-residents

questions.question: What are the anti-abuse provisions in the law?
questions.expected_answer: General Anti-Abuse Rule allows the Authority to make adjustments where arrangements are entered into to obtain a Corporate Tax advantage that is inconsistent with the intention of the law

questions.question: What accounting standards must be used?
questions.expected_answer: Financial Statements must be prepared in accordance with IFRS or other accounting standards as may be accepted by the Authority

questions.question: What are the conditions for tax-neutral business restructurings?
questions.expected_answer: Transfer of assets or liabilities in exchange for shares, parties must be Taxable Persons, and must meet specific conditions including continuity of ownership

questions.question: What expenditures are deductible for corporate tax purposes?
questions.expected_answer: Expenditure incurred wholly and exclusively for business purposes, subject to specific limitations for entertainment, interest, and other specified items

questions.question: What is the interest deduction limitation rule?
questions.expected_answer: Net interest expenditure is limited to 30% of EBITDA, with excess carried forward for up to 10 years

questions.question: What is a Tax Period?
questions.expected_answer: The Gregorian calendar year or the 12-month period for which the Taxable Person prepares Financial Statements

questions.question: Can a taxpayer request clarification from the Authority?
questions.expected_answer: A Taxable Person may apply to the Authority for a clarification on the application of the provisions of this Decree-Law

questions.question: How is foreign tax credit calculated?
questions.expected_answer: Credit for foreign tax paid may be claimed against Corporate Tax payable, limited to the amount of Corporate Tax that would be payable on the foreign-sourced income

questions.question: When is a natural person subject to corporate tax?
questions.expected_answer: A natural person is subject to Corporate Tax if they conduct business or business activity in the UAE with turnover exceeding AED 1,000,000
